poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of Observation"

In the marrow of Moscow, the echo of man,
A shadow cut from life's stolid plan,
He, a specter in turmoil's stead,
Carries forth the silenced dread,

Bitter surveillance with unblinking eyes,
Capturing dissent, truth in disguise.
Yet, springs not freedom from peaceful protest,
In the heart's relentless pursuit of unrest.

An arrested whisper, a chill implied,
In the sterile glory of the verified.
